job.title: Senior Data Scientist - Clinical, Medical and Regulatory
job.description: The Clinical, Medical and Regulatory (CMR) department at Novo Nordisk is one of the most diverse and collaborative groups within the organization. From health-care-provider interactions and developing and implementing regulatory strategies with the Food & Drug Administration (FDA) to providing medical education and collecting data to support efficacy and new product development, CMR is involved. The one thing that keeps us all marching to the same beat is our patient-centered focus. At Novo Nordisk, you will help patients around the world. As their needs evolve, so does our challenge to find better and more innovative ways to improve their quality of life. We’re changing lives for a living. Are you ready to make a difference? The Senior Data Scientist will help drive the Novo Nordisk Inc (NNI) Scientific Analytics vision to explore and develop new solutions that may hold the potential to add value to patients and Novo Nordisk in the future within therapeutic areas covered by Novo Nordisk corporate and commercial strategies. The Senior Data Scientist will build machine learning-based tools and processes, identify and deliver dynamic and reliable analytics products and services by leveraging internal and external data to enable faster decision making across Novo Nordisk; contributing to the growth, competitiveness, and innovation of the company. Acts as an internal analytics consultant to understand the needs of stakeholders, build strategic relationships, and develop/implement innovative solutions that address the needs of the business. The Senior Data Scientist will work with similar roles in Novo Nordisks Big Data Analytics COE, Health Economics & Outcomes Research (HEOR) Analytics, and HR People Research and Analytics to help foster and grow a community of predictive and prescriptive analytics. This position reports the head of Scientific Analytics. Internal relationships include other departments in CMR, including HEOR, Clinical Trial Management, Global Drug Discovery, Global Research Technologies, Global Medical Affairs, Regulatory and Safety, & International Operations, as well as with other data science units globally. Mentors Analytics/Data Science interns and junior departmental staff and oversees projects with external vendors. Extended internal relationships include other Data Science departments across NNI, e.g. Commercial Insights & Analytics, and HR Analytics. External relationships include external collaboration partners, as relevant. 0-10% overnight travel required. We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.  At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.  Novo Nordisk is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by local, state or federal laws, rules or regulations.
